verses.kjv: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of cattle: and when they saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead, that, behold, the place was a place for cattle;
verses.web: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock. They saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead. Behold, the place was a place for livestock.
verses.ct: The tribes of Reuben and Gad owned enormous herds of livestock. When they saw the lands of Jazer and Gilead, they realized it was perfect country for raising cattle.

verses.kjv: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spake unto Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and unto the princes of the congregation, saying,
verses.web: Then the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the princes of the congregation, saying,
verses.ct: So the people of Gad and Reuben came to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the community and said,

verses.kjv: Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Shebam, and Nebo, and Beon,
verses.web: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,
verses.ct: "Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Shebam, Nebo, and Beon—

verses.kjv: Even the country which the LORD smote before the congregation of Israel, is a land for cattle, and thy servants have cattle:
verses.web: the land which LORD struck before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock; and your servants have livestock.”
verses.ct: this whole region that the LORD conquered for the people of Israel—it's ideal land for livestock. And your servants have livestock."

verses.kjv: Wherefore, said they, if we have found grace in thy sight, let this land be given unto thy servants for a possession, and bring us not over Jordan.
verses.web: They said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession. Don’t bring us over the Jordan.”
verses.ct: They continued, "If we've found favor with you, give this land to us as our permanent territory. Don't make us cross the Jordan."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben, Shall your brethren go to war, and shall ye sit here?
verses.web: Moses said to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, “Shall your brothers go to war while you sit here?
verses.ct: Moses replied to the tribes of Gad and Reuben, "Are you really going to sit here while the rest of your brothers go off to war?

verses.kjv: And wherefore discourage ye the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which the LORD hath given them?
verses.web: Why do you discourage the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which LORD has given them?
verses.ct: Why would you discourage the people of Israel from crossing into the land the LORD has given them?

verses.kjv: Thus did your fathers, when I sent them from Kadeshbarnea to see the land.
verses.web: Your fathers did so when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
verses.ct: This is exactly what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadeshbarnea to scout out the land.

verses.kjv: For when they went up unto the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which the LORD had given them.
verses.web: For when they went up to the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which LORD had given them.
verses.ct: They went up to the valley of Eshcol, saw the land, and then crushed the people's courage so they refused to enter the land the LORD had given them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD’s anger was kindled the same time, and he sware, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s anger burned in that day, and he swore, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's anger burned that day, and he swore an oath:

verses.kjv: Surely none of the men that came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I sware unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me:
verses.web: ‘Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me,
verses.ct: 'Not a single man who came out of Egypt, 20 years old or older, will ever see the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—because they did not follow me wholeheartedly.

verses.kjv: Save Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite, and Joshua the son of Nun: for they have wholly followed the LORD.
verses.web: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun, because they have followed LORD completely.’
verses.ct: The only exceptions are Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenezite and Joshua son of Nun, because they followed the LORD completely.'

verses.kjv: And the LORD’s anger was kindled against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation, that had done evil in the sight of the LORD, was consumed.
verses.web: LORD’s anger burned against Israel, and he made them wander back and forth in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation who had done evil in LORD’s sight was consumed.
verses.ct: The LORD's anger burned against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness for 40 years until that entire generation—every person the LORD saw was evil—had died off.

verses.kjv: And, behold, ye are risen up in your fathers’ stead, an increase of sinful men, to augment yet the fierce anger of the LORD toward Israel.
verses.web: “Behold, you have risen up in your fathers’ place, an increase of sinful men, to increase the fierce anger of LORD toward Israel.
verses.ct: "Now look at you! You've risen up in your fathers' place—another crop of sinful men—only to stoke the LORD's fierce anger against Israel even more.

verses.kjv: For if ye turn away from after him, he will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and ye shall destroy all this people.
verses.web: For if you turn away from after him, he will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and you will destroy all these people.”
verses.ct: If you turn away from following him, he'll abandon this people in the wilderness again, and you will be the ones who destroyed them all."

verses.kjv: And they came near unto him, and said, We will build sheepfolds here for our cattle, and cities for our little ones:
verses.web: They came near to him, and said, “We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock, and cities for our little ones;
verses.ct: They stepped forward and said, "We'll build stone pens here for our livestock and fortified cities for our families.

verses.kjv: But we ourselves will go ready armed before the children of Israel, until we have brought them unto their place: and our little ones shall dwell in the fenced cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.web: but we ourselves will be ready armed to go before the children of Israel, until we have brought them to their place. Our little ones shall dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.ct: But we ourselves will arm up and march ahead of the Israelites until we've brought them safely into their land. Meanwhile, our families will stay in the fortified cities, protected from the people already living in this region.

verses.kjv: We will not return unto our houses, until the children of Israel have inherited every man his inheritance.
verses.web: We will not return to our houses until the children of Israel have all received their inheritance.
verses.ct: We won't go home until every Israelite has received their inheritance.

verses.kjv: For we will not inherit with them on yonder side Jordan, or forward; because our inheritance is fallen to us on this side Jordan eastward.
verses.web: For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this side of the Jordan eastward.”
verses.ct: We won't claim any inheritance with them on the west side of the Jordan, because our inheritance has already been given to us here on the east side."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto them, If ye will do this thing, if ye will go armed before the LORD to war,
verses.web: Moses said to them: “If you will do this thing, if you will arm yourselves to go before LORD to the war,
verses.ct: Moses said to them, "If you'll actually do this—if you'll arm yourselves and march before the LORD into war,

verses.kjv: And will go all of you armed over Jordan before the LORD, until he hath driven out his enemies from before him,
verses.web: and every one of your armed men will pass over the Jordan before LORD until he has driven out his enemies from before him,
verses.ct: and if every one of your fighting men crosses the Jordan before the LORD until he has driven out his enemies,

verses.kjv: And the land be subdued before the LORD: then afterward ye shall return, and be guiltless before the LORD, and before Israel; and this land shall be your possession before the LORD.
verses.web: and the land is subdued before LORD; then afterward you shall return, and be clear of obligation to LORD and to Israel. Then this land shall be your possession before LORD.
verses.ct: and the land is fully conquered before the LORD—then afterward you may return. You'll be free of obligation to the LORD and to Israel, and this land will be yours in the LORD's sight.

verses.kjv: But if ye will not do so, behold, ye have sinned against the LORD: and be sure your sin will find you out.
verses.web: “But if you will not do so, behold, you have sinned against LORD; and be sure your sin will find you out.
verses.ct: But if you don't follow through, you will have sinned against the LORD—and be sure your sin will find you out.

verses.kjv: Build you cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which hath proceeded out of your mouth.
verses.web: Build cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which has proceeded out of your mouth.”
verses.ct: Go ahead and build cities for your families and pens for your flocks. But you must keep your word."

verses.kjv: And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben spake unto Moses, saying, Thy servants will do as my lord commandeth.
verses.web: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben spoke to Moses, saying, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
verses.ct: The tribes of Gad and Reuben answered Moses, "Your servants will do exactly as our lord commands.

verses.kjv: Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our cattle, shall be there in the cities of Gilead:
verses.web: Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock shall be there in the cities of Gilead;
verses.ct: Our children, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock will remain here in the cities of Gilead.

verses.kjv: But thy servants will pass over, every man armed for war, before the LORD to battle, as my lord saith.
verses.web: but your servants will pass over, every man who is armed for war, before LORD to battle, as my lord says.”
verses.ct: But every one of your servants who can fight will cross over and go to battle before the LORD, just as our lord has said."

verses.kjv: So concerning them Moses commanded Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel:
verses.web: So Moses commanded concerning them to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers’ households of the tribes of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: So Moses gave instructions about them to Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the tribal leaders of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto them, If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will pass with you over Jordan, every man armed to battle, before the LORD, and the land shall be subdued before you; then ye shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession:
verses.web: Moses said to them, “If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will pass with you over the Jordan, every man who is armed to battle before LORD, and the land is subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession;
verses.ct: Moses told them, "If the men of Gad and Reuben cross the Jordan with you—every man armed for battle before the LORD—and the land is conquered, then you must give them the land of Gilead as their territory.

verses.kjv: But if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.
verses.web: but if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”
verses.ct: But if they don't cross over armed with you, they'll receive their territory among you in the land of Canaan instead."

verses.kjv: And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, As the LORD hath said unto thy servants, so will we do.
verses.web: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, “As LORD has said to your servants, so will we do.
verses.ct: The tribes of Gad and Reuben answered, "Whatever the LORD has told your servants, that's what we'll do.

verses.kjv: We will pass over armed before the LORD into the land of Canaan, that the possession of our inheritance on this side Jordan may be ours.
verses.web: We will pass over armed before LORD into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us beyond the Jordan.”
verses.ct: We will cross over armed before the LORD into Canaan, and our inherited territory will remain ours here on the east side of the Jordan."

verses.kjv: And Moses gave unto them, even to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and unto half the tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land, with the cities thereof in the coasts, even the cities of the country round about.
verses.web: Moses gave to them, even to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan; the land, according to its cities and borders, even the cities of the surrounding land.
verses.ct: So Moses gave the tribes of Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan—the entire land with all its cities and the surrounding territory.

verses.kjv: And the children of Gad built Dibon, and Ataroth, and Aroer,
verses.web: The children of Gad built Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
verses.ct: The tribe of Gad rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,

verses.kjv: And Atroth, Shophan, and Jaazer, and Jogbehah,
verses.web: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
verses.ct: Atroth, Shophan, Jaazer, Jogbehah,

verses.kjv: And Bethnimrah, and Bethharan, fenced cities: and folds for sheep.
verses.web: Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran: fortified cities and folds for sheep.
verses.ct: Bethnimrah, and Bethharan as fortified cities, and they built pens for their sheep.

verses.kjv: And the children of Reuben built Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kirjathaim,
verses.web: The children of Reuben built Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
verses.ct: The tribe of Reuben rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kirjathaim,

verses.kjv: And Nebo, and Baalmeon, (their names being changed,) and Shibmah: and gave other names unto the cities which they builded.
verses.web: Nebo, and Baal Meon, (their names being changed), and Sibmah. They gave other names to the cities which they built.
verses.ct: Nebo, and Baalmeon (whose names were changed), and Shibmah. They renamed the cities they rebuilt.

verses.kjv: And the children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, and took it, and dispossessed the Amorite which was in it.
verses.web: The children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, took it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were therein.
verses.ct: The descendants of Machir son of Manasseh marched into Gilead, captured it, and drove out the Amorites living there.

verses.kjv: And Moses gave Gilead unto Machir the son of Manasseh; and he dwelt therein.
verses.web: Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh; and he lived therein.
verses.ct: Moses gave Gilead to Machir son of Manasseh, and his clan settled there.

verses.kjv: And Jair the son of Manasseh went and took the small towns thereof, and called them Havothjair.
verses.web: Jair the son of Manasseh went and took its villages, and called them Havvoth Jair.
verses.ct: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, captured the villages in the area and named them Havothjair.

verses.kjv: And Nobah went and took Kenath, and the villages thereof, and called it Nobah, after his own name.
verses.web: Nobah went and took Kenath and its villages, and called it Nobah, after his own name.
verses.ct: Nobah captured Kenath and its surrounding villages and renamed it Nobah, after himself.
